comments: a(n-1)=sum(P(13;n-1-k,k),k=0..ceiling((n-1)/2)), n>=1, with a(-1)=12. These are the SW-NE diagonals in P(13;n,k), the (13,1) Pascal triangle. Cf. A093645 for the (10,1) Pascal triangle. Observation by _Paul Barry_, Apr 29 2004. Proof via recursion relations and comparison of inputs.In general, for a Fibonacci sequence beginning with 1,b we have a(n)=(2^(-1-n)((1-Sqrt[5])^n(1+Sqrt[5]-2b)+(1+Sqrt[5])^n(-1+Sqrt[5]+2b)))/Sqrt[5]. - _Herbert Kociemba_, Dec 18 2011Pisano period lengths: 1, 3, 8, 6, 4, 24, 16, 12, 24, 12, 10, 24, 28, 48, 8, 24, 36, 24, 18, 12, ... (is this A106291?). - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2012
maple: with(numtheory): with(combinat): P:=proc(q) local n;for n from 0 to q do print(13*fibonacci(n)+fibonacci(n-1));od; end: P(30); # _Paolo P. Lava_, May 19 2015
prog: (MAGMA) a0:=1; a1:=13; [GeneralizedFibonacciNumber(a0, a1, n): n in [0..30]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 12 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
